intro: Costera lanaensis, commonly known as the woolly costera, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woolly leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
